messages.message: not sure the place to ask this: intelligent hub decided today that it was very important that I update my computer, and warned me that it will do so in 2 hours without an option to delay. I promptly forgot about this and kept doing what I was doing, and then 2 hours later everything on my machine shut down without warning while I was in the middle of working. luckily I didn't really lose anything important, but wondering if there's a way to schedule this to not happen in the middle of the day or allow me to delay the update? my own fault for ignoring the warning earlier in the day, but still a bit of an inconvenience to have to wait for an OS upgrade in the middle of the workday :slightly_smiling_face:

Well timed in that I’ll be sending out a message about or migration off WS1/Intelligence Hub this afternoon, we’ll be happy to get you over to the new MDM tool that has some better notifications around patching.

That said, MDM tools all have some challenges here, and we do enforce patches to be installed within two weeks of their release, so I do always recommend applying any as you see notifications for them as we do have to enforce them for our compliance requirements.

Kandji will be better at noting those with a red dot in the menu bar, but I still suggest to people a bi monthly calendar reminder on Friday at the end of the day so you can kick off any patches with less interruption
Feel free to reach out <mailto:ithelp@instabase.com|ithelp@instabase.com> if you want to hop to the front of the line for the migration
(more details in that email to come soon)
is there any way to schedule an update to run while the computer isn't actively being used? e.g. if an update is auto-installed at midnight on a given day it might be less disruptive that way
Kandji is generally set to push compliance requirements around 4pm PT when it comes to apps and OS patching
However if a machine is offline it won’t receive the push until it boots back up/unsleeps
It’s a little difficult to pick a winning time for it as we are a global company though so thus the recommendation to patch when you can rather than the forced patching route.
I see, makes sense. thanks for explaining, I'll add a reminder on my calendar to update in the future
Sure thing, and the notifications from Kandji are much clearer as well

@Dave I think this issue will become more prevalent as we do more security/compliance work. We already had an instance of it a couple weeks ago with the firewall

When we push these types of updates, can we have a blast in some sort of public forum either through email or on slack before it happens? We need to make these very very explicit so people are not surprised. This is particularly important for engineering because it impacts our work efficiency. If engineers are not surprised by these updates, then they can better prepare for it.

@Eric Han to be clear this policy and WS1 tooling has been in place for any machine running it for a long time.

The only changes in question are the solution I was presenting him with and that notification is going out today.
